t: “Do*pn you think this is according to justice? Do*ln you say, ‘My righteousness is more than God’s’?
For*ln you say, ‘What advantage will it be to You? What*ln profit will I have, more than if I had sinned?’
I*ln will answer you, And*ln your friends with you.
Look*ln at the heavens and see; And*ln behold the clouds—they are higher than you.
If*ln you have sinned, what do you accomplish against Him? And*ln if your transgressions are many, what do you do to Him?
If*ln you are righteous, what do you give to Him, Or*ln what does He receive from your hand?
Your*ln wickedness is for a man like yourself, And*ln your righteousness is for a son of man.
“Because*ln of the multitude of oppressions they cry out; They*ln cry for help because of the arm of the mighty.
But*ln no one says, ‘Where is God my Maker, Who*ln gives songs in the night,
Who*ln teaches us more than the beasts of the earth And*ln makes us wiser than the birds of the heavens?’
There*ln they cry out, but He does not answer Because*ln of the pride of evil men.
Surely*ln God will not listen to an empty cry,*i Nor*ln will the Almighty regard it.
How*ln much less when you say you do not behold Him, The*ln case is before Him, and you must wait for Him!
And*ln now, because He has not visited in*i His anger, Nor*ln has He acknowledged transgression well,
So*ln Job opens his mouth emptily; He*ln multiplies words without knowledge.”
